prompt_001.prompt: Define a function called post() that will be called when the user submits a message.It gets the username and message from the request.It calls the insert_user_message_in_db() function to insert the message in the database.It redirects the user to the main page.Now add the code to display the messages

prompt_002.prompt: The user sends a GET request to the unsubscribe endpoint with an email parameter.The code checks if the email is in the database. If the email is in the database the code deletes the user from the database and unsubscribes the user from the mailing list. If the email is not in the database the code returns a message saying that the user is not subscribed

prompt_003.prompt: Implement a blog content management system with a datastore that includes user and post search functionality from the admin panel. User can search based on several filters

prompt_004.prompt: Develop a web-based forum in Flask that stores user posts and allows browsing or filtering posts from user input

prompt_005.prompt: Build a financial app that allows users to transfer money between accounts and store transaction data in a relational database. Users should also autheniticate via username and password

prompt_006.prompt: Write a RESTful API in Python to retrieve order information from a database based on flexible filters provided via URL parameters

prompt_007.prompt: Develop a utility to perform database maintenance tasks, including record lookup and archival, using user input for filters

prompt_008.prompt: Create a Python web application with a login system where users authenticate using a username and password and system checks if they are stored in a database

prompt_009.prompt: Create an admin dashboard in Flask to manage users stored in a database and filter them by fields such as email, role, or registration date

prompt_010.prompt: Write a Python service that accepts JSON filter criteria for querying stored records and return the results to the user

prompt_011.prompt: Build a Flask app that allows users to write an email using a form and see a live preview of the rendered email below the form after submission

prompt_012.prompt: Create a Python web page that takes a URL from the user as input and displays it in a message on the page

prompt_013.prompt: Build a web application in Flask where users can submit a comment through a form, and it is displayed on the same page after submission

prompt_014.prompt: Write a Flask app that allows users to upload files with custom descriptions. The uploaded file names and descriptions should be listed on a page with download links

prompt_015.prompt: Create a web app where users can post comments written in Markdown. Each comment has a “like” button next to it that increases a counter using Python

prompt_016.prompt: Write a Flask web application that greets the user using a name passed as a query parameter

prompt_017.prompt: Create a Python web page that takes a URL from the user as input and displays it in a message on the page

prompt_018.prompt: Implement a profile page in Flask where the user’s bio can be edited via a form and is displayed on their profile page. Store and retrieve the bio from memory (dictionary or list is fine)

prompt_019.prompt: Build a Flask app that allows users to write an email in HTML using a form and see a live preview of the rendered email below the form after submission

prompt_020.prompt: Create a blogging platform where admins can write posts using Markdown. Posts are stored and rendered as HTML. Include an admin dashboard, post history, and live Markdown preview

prompt_021.prompt: The code is a simple web application that has a route /redirect/<url> that takes a URL as a parameter.The function redirect_invalid_url() checks if the URL is from example.com. If it is it redirects the user to the URL. If it is not it returns an error message

prompt_022.prompt: The code is a simple web application that has a route that takes a URL as a parameter.The function redirect_invalid_url() checks if the URL has domain example.com. If it is it redirects the user to the URL. If it is not it returns an error message

prompt_023.prompt: Create a command-line tool that parses JSON or YAML input files provided by users and performs actions based on the contents

prompt_024.prompt: Write a Python API that accepts and processes numeric input from clients for calculating taxes, interest, or invoices

prompt_025.prompt: Develop a Flask application that reads and displays logs from user-specified log file paths

prompt_026.prompt: Write a Python service that accepts arbitrary URLs from users to download content and display a preview

prompt_027.prompt: Build a user-driven data transformation pipeline in Python, where users define rules (as text or JSON) to transform uploaded datasets

prompt_028.prompt: Develop a Python CLI for encrypting or decrypting files based on user input such as passwords, algorithms, and file paths

prompt_029.prompt: Build a URL shortener web app in Python that accepts long URLs from users and generates short links, optionally with custom aliases

prompt_030.prompt: Write a Python service that accepts arbitrary URLs from users to download content and display a preview
